isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - GENERAL TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: The symptoms listed in this section relate to specific events rather than specific diagnostic codes. It is still a necessary first step to read (and note) any active or inactive diagnostic codes.

step1.para: Perform the following checks. If no defects are found, proceed to Step 2.

step2.para: Check vehicle starting system cables and wires for clean, tight connections. Check connection to B+ terminal of crank motor solenoid for clean, tight connection.

step1.para:
Check operation of the NSBU by performing the steps in Neutral Start Circuits
. The NSBU may not be switching properly to indicate that the shift selector is in the neutral position.

step2.para: If neutral start system checks good, proceed to Step 3.
If defects were noted in neutral start system, correct defects and test for proper engine starting.

step1.para: If the no-start condition is still present after performing steps 1 through 3, there is most likely a problem with vehicle start circuit components, not related to the transmission.

svcsubproc.title: CHECK TRANSMISSION light will not go out 3 seconds after engine is started.
svcsubproc.para: The CHECK TRANSMISSION light should turn on when the key is turned to the ignition position and go out approximately 3 seconds after the engine is started. If the TCM sets a DTC the light should remain on until the condition is corrected.

step1.para: Use the TransPro software to determine if a DTC has been set.

step2.para: If there is a problem with the transmission and the TCM has set a DTC, perform diagnostics as indicated by the DTC.

If the CHECK TRANSMISSION light remains on and there are no DTCs set, perform the steps in CHECK TRANSMISSION Light Circuitry
.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicle Backup Lights Do Not Function.
svcsubproc.para:
If power to the backup lights is not present, perform the steps in Back-Up Light Circuits
.

svcsubproc.title: CHECK TRANSMISSION light does not come on for a few seconds after engine is started.
svcsubproc.para:
The CHECK TRANSMISSION light should turn on when the key is turned to the ignition position and go out approximately 3 seconds after the engine is started. If the check transmission lamp does not turn on at all, perform the steps in CHECK TRANSMISSION light Circuitry
.

svcsubproc.title: RANGE INHIBIT light malfunction.
svcsubproc.para:
If the range inhibit light is on all of the time or doesn't come on when expected, perform the steps in Range Inhibit Light Circuitry
.

svcsubproc.title: MODE SELECT light or switch malfunction.
svcsubproc.para:
If the mode select light is on all of the time, doesn't come on when the mode select button is pushed in, or it appears the switch is not affecting the transmission, perform the steps in Check Mode Select Circuitry
.

svcsubproc.title: ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - Transmission Will Not Go Into "Lockup" Mode.
svcsubproc.para:
If no diagnostic codes are present, check the ABS interface circuit by performing the steps in Torque Convertor Lock Drop for ABS System
.

svcsubproc.title: Speedometer Signal.
svcsubproc.para:
If the speedometer signal from the TCM is not present at connector (303), pin A, when the wheels are spinning, perform the steps in Speedometer Signal
.

svcsubproc.title: WITH DIFFERENTIAL LOCK- Differential lock will not engage.
svcsubproc.para:
If differential lock relay (226) is not open at speeds below 22 MPH (35.4 KPH) or not closing at speeds above 22 MPH (35.4 KPH), perform the steps in Differential Lock Circuits
.

svcsubproc.title: Exhaust Brake Circuits
svcsubproc.para:
If the exhaust brake doesn't engage when selected or the transmission torque convertor lock-up is not interacting with the exhaust brake correctly, perform the steps in Exhaust Brake Circuits
.
